title: The List Alchemist
subtitle: Advanced List Operations
description:
# Mastering List Manipulation

You know the basics of lists. Now learn powerful techniques to transform and analyze them!

## List Methods

```python
items = ["sword", "potion", "shield"]

# Add items
items.append("armor")         # Add to end
items.insert(1, "bow")         # Insert at position
items.extend(["axe", "helm"])  # Add multiple

# Remove items
items.remove("potion")  # Remove by value
item = items.pop()       # Remove and return last
item = items.pop(0)      # Remove and return at index

# Find items
index = items.index("sword")  # Get position
count = items.count("potion") # Count occurrences

# Sort and reverse
items.sort()     # Sort in place
items.reverse()  # Reverse in place
```

## List Slicing

```python
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

first_three = numbers[:3]   # [1, 2, 3]
last_two = numbers[-2:]     # [4, 5]
middle = numbers[1:4]       # [2, 3, 4]
every_other = numbers[::2]  # [1, 3, 5]
```

## Your Quest

Create an inventory management system:
1. Add, remove, and search items
2. Sort inventory by name
3. Use slicing to get different subsets
4. Find and count specific items

solutionCode:
# Advanced Inventory System

inventory = ["sword", "potion", "shield", "potion", "gold", "map"]

print("Starting inventory:", inventory)
print()

# Add items to inventory
print("=== ADDING ITEMS ===")
inventory.append("helmet")
inventory.insert(2, "bow")
print("After adding:", inventory)
print()

# Remove items
print("=== REMOVING ITEMS ===")
inventory.remove("potion")
last_item = inventory.pop()
print(f"Removed: {last_item}")
print("After removing:", inventory)
print()

# Find items
print("=== SEARCHING ===")
sword_position = inventory.index("sword")
potion_count = inventory.count("potion")
print(f"Sword is at position: {sword_position}")
print(f"Number of potions: {potion_count}")
print()

# Sort inventory
print("=== SORTING ===")
inventory.sort()
print("Sorted inventory:", inventory)
print()

# List slicing
print("=== SLICING ===")
first_three = inventory[:3]
last_two = inventory[-2:]
every_other = inventory[::2]
print(f"First 3 items: {first_three}")
print(f"Last 2 items: {last_two}")
print(f"Every other item: {every_other}")
hints: Use inventory.append('helmet') to add to the end
Use inventory.insert(2, 'bow') to insert at position 2
Use inventory.remove('potion') to remove first occurrence
Slicing: [:3] for first 3, [-2:] for last 2, [::2] for every other
